intro: Vittadinia hispidula var. setosa, commonly known as the hairy everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, fluffy appearance due to the presence of fine hairs on its stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Vittadinia hispidula var. setosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its long-lasting blooms.
